grade_comment:
Grade: 90

Comment: The answer provides a solid explanation of who was permitted to enter the "most holy place" and why this restriction was important in ancient Jewish tradition. It correctly highlights the role of the high priest as a mediator and the emphasis on the sacredness and purity of the space. The only improvement would be to explicitly mention the significance of the high priest's role in carrying out the atonement for the sins of the people on the Day of Atonement.
